posts.post_content:
Original concept (http://www.wizards.com/Magic/Magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtgcom/feature/115) had him destroying any wall he hit.  
  
That would have made him the Kool-Aid man. And for that, he's awesome.
posts.html:

Posted By: Andon_A (8/13/2010 9:38:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
What a strange card. He looks completely human, not artifact-y at all.  
The point isn't that he has protection from walls, it's that he ties up your opponent's best defenders while letting your other guys go through. People did play walls at some point, and he'd still do well against stuff like [Wall of Denial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Denial).
